item.description:
Join the Park Interpreter on a recreational hike each week into a different part of Myles Standish State Forest.  Each hike travels along different trails and is about 3 to 4 miles in length.  Join us for one hike or come for the whole series!  Please wear bug spray, sunscreen, and supportive shoes.  Bring along water and a snack.  For adults and older children who can hike 3 to 4 miles of moderately difficult trails.  All children must be accompanied by an adult.

The parking lot is on Charge Pond Road. It is only accessible from within the park. (If you are unfamiliar with the park, follow the signs within the park or get a map here. Don't let your GPS strand you on Charge Pond Road from Route 28 in Wareham unless you want to add a couple of miles to your hiking.)

This hike is offered by a DCR ranger.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Off the Beaten Path Sunday Hike
